intro: Volutarella lippii, commonly known as the desert daisy, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of North America. It is characterized by its compact, low-growing habit and produces showy, daisy-like flowers in shades of yellow and white. The plant has thick, fleshy leaves that help it conserve water in its harsh environment. Volutarella lippii is adapted to full sun and well-drained soils, making it a resilient species in desert ecosystems. Its nectar attracts various pollinators, including bees and butterflies, contributing to local biodiversity.
